content:
Okay, here are my expected goals for designing and implementing core game mechanics over the next four weeks:

*   **Week 1:** Focus on prototyping the basic movement system and player input. I want to get a solid foundation for how the player controls their character and interacts with the environment. I'll also start researching different movement techniques used in similar games.
*   **Week 2:** Implement the core combat mechanics. This includes basic attacks, enemy AI for simple interactions, and hit detection. I'd like to have a functional, albeit simple, combat loop by the end of the week. I plan to start with a very basic AI, like a simple 'chase and attack' behavior.
*   **Week 3:** Expand on the core mechanics by adding a basic resource system (e.g., health, mana, or stamina) and integrate it with the combat and movement systems. I also want to implement a simple UI to display these resources. Also maybe add some basic sound effects for the core mechanics.
*   **Week 4:** Polish and refine the existing mechanics based on testing and feedback. This includes bug fixing, balancing, and improving the overall player experience. I also want to document the implemented systems clearly. This is also time to begin considering how these mechanics can be expanded upon for future features.

Okay, here's the outline of programming tasks for the system architecture and gameplay functionality, week by week, based on Priya's goals:

**Week 1: Core Movement and Player Input**
*   **System Architecture:** Set up the basic project structure and version control. Create the player character class and integrate the input system. Establish the core game loop. Initial setup of collision detection.
*   **Gameplay Functionality:** Implement basic player movement (walk, run, jump). Handle player input from keyboard/mouse/controller. Prototype camera controls and follow behavior. Implement basic collision to prevent the player from walking through walls.

**Week 2: Core Combat Mechanics**
*   **System Architecture:** Design and implement the combat system architecture (damage calculation, hit detection, AI interface). Implement basic AI classes and integrate them with the game world. 
*   **Gameplay Functionality:** Implement basic attack animations and logic. Create simple enemy AI (chase and attack). Implement hit detection and damage application. Ensure player and enemy characters have health values.

**Week 3: Resource System and UI**
*   **System Architecture:** Implement a resource management system (health, mana, stamina). Design and integrate UI elements to display resource values. Add basic audio manager and integrate sound effects.
*   **Gameplay Functionality:** Integrate the resource system with combat and movement (e.g., stamina drain for running). Implement UI elements to display health, mana, and stamina. Add sound effects for attacks, impacts, and player actions.

**Week 4: Polish, Refinement, and Documentation**
*   **System Architecture:** Refactor code for improved performance and maintainability. Implement robust error handling and logging. Document the implemented systems thoroughly.
*   **Gameplay Functionality:** Bug fixing and balancing of existing mechanics. Iterate on player feedback to improve the overall experience. Add polish to movement, combat, and UI elements. Begin documenting systems with code comments and design documents. Explore expanding on core mechanics with new features and abilities.

Okay, here are the visual concepts, character designs, and environmental art goals outlined for the next four weeks: 

**Week 1: Core Movement and Player Input**
*   **Visual Concepts:** Initial sketches and mood boards for the game world. Focus on establishing the overall art style and color palette. Simple blockout models for the environment to test player movement and scale.
*   **Character Designs:** Concept art for the player character, focusing on silhouette and basic features. Initial exploration of character animations (walk cycle, idle pose).
*   **Environmental Art Goals:** Create a small, playable area with basic environmental assets (walls, floors, simple props). The focus should be on functionality and readability, not high fidelity.

**Week 2: Core Combat Mechanics**
*   **Visual Concepts:** Development of enemy character designs. Concept art for basic attack animations and visual effects (e.g., impact sparks). UI concepts for health bars and other combat-related information.
*   **Character Designs:** Detailed character models for the first enemy type. Implementation of basic attack animations for both the player and the enemy.
*   **Environmental Art Goals:** Expand the playable area with more detailed environmental assets. Add visual elements to indicate interactive objects or points of interest.

**Week 3: Resource System and UI**
*   **Visual Concepts:** UI design for the resource system (health, mana, stamina). Visual effects for resource depletion and replenishment. Concept art for any special abilities or power-ups.
*   **Character Designs:** Visual polish of existing character models and animations. Implementation of visual feedback for resource usage (e.g., character glows when using mana).
*   **Environmental Art Goals:** Add more detail and variety to the environment. Implement visual cues to guide the player and communicate game information.

**Week 4: Polish, Refinement, and Documentation**
*   **Visual Concepts:** Final polish of all visual assets. Creation of marketing materials (screenshots, trailers). Iterate on visual feedback based on playtesting.
*   **Character Designs:** Bug fixing and refinement of character models and animations. Optimize character assets for performance.
*   **Environmental Art Goals:** Optimization of environmental assets for performance. Bug fixing and visual polish of the game world. Creation of a cohesive and visually appealing game experience.

I am unable to create a pandas DataFrame directly. However, I can provide the data in a JSON format that represents the structure a pandas DataFrame would have, which you can then easily load into a DataFrame using pandas in Python. Here's the JSON:

```json
{
  "columns": ["Week", "Role", "Objectives"],
  "data": [
    ["Week 1", "Junior Developer (Priya Sharma)", "Prototype basic movement and player input. Research movement techniques."],
    ["Week 1", "Lead Programmer (Kenji Tanaka)", "Set up project structure, version control. Create player character class and integrate input system. Establish core game loop. Initial collision detection setup. Implement basic player movement, handle input, prototype camera controls, implement basic collision."],
    ["Week 1", "Game Designer (Ricardo Silva)", "Initial sketches and mood boards. Simple blockout models for environment. Concept art for player character. Initial animation exploration. Create small playable area with basic assets."],
    ["Week 2", "Junior Developer (Priya Sharma)", "Implement core combat mechanics (attacks, enemy AI, hit detection). Get basic combat loop functional."],
    ["Week 2", "Lead Programmer (Kenji Tanaka)", "Design combat system architecture, implement basic AI classes. Implement basic attack animations, simple enemy AI, hit detection and damage application. Ensure characters have health."],
    ["Week 2", "Game Designer (Ricardo Silva)", "Develop enemy character designs. Concept art for attack animations and VFX. UI concepts for combat information. Detailed character models for first enemy. Implement basic attack animations."],
    ["Week 3", "Junior Developer (Priya Sharma)", "Expand core mechanics with resource system and integrate. Implement simple UI. Add basic sound effects."],
    ["Week 3", "Lead Programmer (Kenji Tanaka)", "Implement resource management system, design UI elements, add audio manager. Integrate resource system with combat/movement. Implement UI elements for resources. Add sound effects."],
    ["Week 3", "Game Designer (Ricardo Silva)", "UI design for resource system. Visual effects for resource changes. Concept art for abilities/power-ups. Polish character models, implement visual feedback for resource usage. Add detail to environment."],
    ["Week 4", "Junior Developer (Priya Sharma)", "Polish and refine mechanics based on testing and feedback. Bug fixing, balancing, and documentation. Consider expanding on mechanics."],
    ["Week 4", "Lead Programmer (Kenji Tanaka)", "Refactor code, implement error handling and logging, document systems. Bug fixing and balancing. Iterate on feedback. Polish elements. Document systems and explore expanding mechanics."],
    ["Week 4", "Game Designer (Ricardo Silva)", "Final polish of visuals, create marketing materials. Iterate on feedback. Bug fixing and refinement of character models. Optimize assets. Optimize environment, bug fixing, polish."]
  ]
}
```

Okay, team, I've compiled everyone's goals into a single document. Let's review this together to make sure we're all on the same page and that the responsibilities are clear and achievable. We'll go through each week, role by role. Junior Developer (Priya), Lead Programmer (Kenji), and Game Designer (Ricardo), please provide your feedback as we go through this document and confirm that you're aligned with the project.
